alert.note: Alert for GUC100; GUC110; GUC120; Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 20 at 7:33PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. Tropical Depression 02W continues to develop well south-southeast of Guam/southwest of Chuuk. This system is forecast to continue to strengthen over the next few days as it moves north-northwest toward the Marianas. We have high confidence that a significant tropical cyclone will move through the Marianas in the coming week. What track it`ll take and at what strength remains to be seen, though model variability is decreasing. Regardless of strength and track, a very high likelihood for heavy rainfall exists. Timing: Tuesday through Thursday Locations: All of the Mariana Islands Amounts: At least 6 to 10 inches of rainfall. Note: Locally higher rainfall totals are likely, depending on storm location. Urban and Small Stream Flooding and/or Flash Flooding is possible early next week as the system moves through the region. Closely monitor this developing situation in the event watches, advisories, or warnings are needed. Forecasts will change in the coming days as this situation evolves. Ensure nearby storm drains are not clogged, especially for low- lying or flood-prone areas.
